content:
Hello there

To erase all emails from one sender in Thunderbird. Try to sort them from the sender. You can sort these emails from the sender to select all relevant emails and then delete them.you can use the quickfilter https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/quick-filter-toolbar to use it but I do not recommend it is from 2023 and the normal way should fix also.

If the emails are spread across the email lists you can use global search by typing the senders their name to find them and then to locate them and try to delete these emails.

To erase more emails is to select one email and hold down that shift key and go down to the list of all these emails that are going to be deleted soon and click on the last one.. All emails are selected now , press that delete button to erase them .

You can also click on the first email to erase from that sender. Holding the shift key or cmd button if you are on a Mac machine. Click on some other email to delete it separately and so you can delete some email in between of it from that unwanted email there in that received list of email.

Questions are open

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

If you do not like to have and get or recief some mail for a moment from that certain sender of emails? You could do some configuration with thunderbird s good filters to block that person from getting in that inbox of you if you need to. You can open the email from that sender or other senders. Try to click on that person his or her e-mailadres in the field of from. Select create filter from.. Name that filter to block sender or other. Go in or to the action section you could do a change and change it to ‘delete that message’ when that message is incoming mail to the inbox email section. Click on ok to save that setting.

Filters can give some trouble . When the system is overloaded on multiple points. Do it right and they work fine.


Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

When you use the programmetje inbox is not working. If the inbox for incoming email messages is continuous crashing while clicking on it with that mouse button , the options to get that program fixed is to check for the add ons that are installed . https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Try to start up in safe mode for Thunderbird and see if the program works fine now? If so , then there a bad add on was interrupting that good software. Try to find and erase that no good add ons in the list of add on.

Updating the the software is also a good point for solving that issue to the latest version of it or getting and getting a new profile to work with does works fine to. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

If non of this solutions work and the inbox is still crashing or is also still blocking the use of it?Then consider to uninstall the complete program by erasing it and be sure to get the latest version of the software from trusted download points direct from our Thunderbird site that is online.

Questions are open.

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content: Thunderbird zelf gebruikt geen wachtwoord, u bedoelt waarschijnlijk het wachtwoord voor de mailaccount. content: Great question definitely sounds like a MIME structure issue if Thunderbird is decrypting but not displaying the content. Thunderbird can be particular about Content-Type and multipart boundaries in OpenPGP messages. It would be helpful to see a sample .eml structure that works. Hopefully someone can share a known good format or a tool to validate these.
creator: ethan547423

content:
Hello there


You can try to adjust these junkmail settings ,change the junksettings . Try to make some filters for these settings. If you had some mail filters as for junkmail settings try to disable them. You can go to tools and try to go to message filters.) Click on new to create a new filter. Give that filter a name like inbox email. Set that filter to apply when getting that new mail. Choose match any of the following and set the conditions for example :

"From" "contains" "your_contact_email_address" "Subject" "contains" "important_keyword".

Set the action to “Select message to” and select the inbox from the program. Click on oké to save these settings of that new filter.

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content: Filters run automatically only on the Inbox, and only affect Inbox messages. To apply them to other folders such as Sent, they must be initiated manually, as you describe.
creator: sfhowes

content: So why include a "To" option because all emails that I send "To" someone all go to the Sent folder and there fore by your reasoning wouldn't be detected by the rule?
creator: lloydhousley

content: The To, Cc or Bcc options allow for a filter to be applied to a folder with sent messages. If such a filter is applied to the Inbox, only the From or Cc options are relevant.

content:
I don't know what video or help pages you saw, but these steps work. They transfer the entire profile (accounts, settings, local folders).

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder, close TB, delete or rename logins.json, cert9.db and key4.db. This will remove the primary and all account passwords, and reset the certificate stores when TB restarts.

Can you go to thunderbird settings? If you can go to settings and try to click on it. Go to privacy and security and then -passwords. Click on saved passwords . Find that relevant email account in the list and click on show passwords. Confirm there and delete that normal shown password with some mouse clicks from that infected account. Restart Thunderbird and there becomes a new input field prompted to react and type there that normal password again.
